utterance.speaker: TOM DEMMING
utterance.content: You need someone to steady your bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you offering?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah. Sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Anytime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: All right. Here comes the turn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mm. Actually, sweetie, it's called the River.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Right. Right. The, uh, fifth community card is called "the River" or "fifth street."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now you're on the trolley, kid.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So... who won?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, actually, you had me until the River.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. And you got a third Jack, and trip Jacks beat trip 9s. You win.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, don't sweat it, sweetheart. Just your first lesson. What do you say we call it a night?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What? No. Let's keep playing. Shuffle up and deal.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, hello, darlings. Oh, what's all this?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad's teaching me the basics of no-limit Texas Hold'em.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I'm shocked--shocked- there's gambling in here. Deal me in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good evening, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim's name is Paul Finch. According to the registration, it's his car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We ran him for next of kin, found his wife.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She's on her way in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And his rap sheet. He's a thief... Couple of bank jobs, some corporate B_Es. But he hasn't been arrested in a few years. So he's either really lucky...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or he's out of the game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I'd say he was electrocuted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This voltage had to be pretty high for him to get burns like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, sure. You connect these leads directly into the ignition system, you rev the engine high enough...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like they were trying to torture him, but ended up killing him instead.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Either way, it wasn't pleasant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, whoever did this either wanted to send a message or needed something from him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What would somebody need from a retired...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His eyes are closed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anyone touch the body before you came here?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nope. It was like that when I got here. The killer must have closed 'em postmortem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT AND CASTLE
utterance.content: That means he knew the victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would say, he probably felt guilty about what he had done, wanted to erase it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have C.S.U. sweep the cars, and let's fume the body. Maybe we'll get some prints off of his eyelids.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You tell me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he was murdered by the artist formerly known as Prince.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Finch, we're very sorry for your loss. Does this... Look familiar to you at all?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell you what or who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the guy comes out of retirement for one job and ends up dead. That cannot be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, what lures a guy who's been retired for years back into the game?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Must've been something big.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was Robbery on the phone. They logged in a break-in at a branch of Manhattan Mutual the day before yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bank heist. That fits with Finch's profile.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did they have any details?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope. They're sending the new guy up now.

utterance.speaker: TOM DEMMING
utterance.content: And that would be me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh-ho! What's up, bro? How you doing? Why didn't you tell me you transferred?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Ah, you know, I been settling in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, uh, this is my boy- Tom Demming. He was one of the best cops back at the 54th. This is my partner--Ryan.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: How you doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, nice to meet you, man.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: You, too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, the author, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And this is Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, we met.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Hi.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Hi. So Paul Finch, huh? He's one of the few guys on the island who could've taken a score like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: A couple of pros tunnel into the vault, drill open a safe deposit box, leave nothing behind but the great smell of Brut.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you think that Finch couldn't have pulled this off on his own?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Nah, it's a 2-man job at the minimum. There's definitely another player floating around out there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we've run a search for his phone records and financials, so hopefully we'll find something that ties him to a partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe the partner turned on Finch after the robbery, decided he didn't need him anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Either way, we know that the robbery and the homicide are connected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That seems like an awful lot of trouble for one safe deposit box.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah. And they left stacks of cash untouched. The guys downstairs thought I was nuts when I hopped on this case, but I like the weird ones.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm. How about that? Beckett likes the weird ones, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What could be in that box that would be worth digging tunnel to and killing for? Diamonds? German bearer bonds? Nazi gold?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Ah, we still don't know yet. The bank had some trouble locating the owner, but he's supposed to be coming in this afternoon. Would you like to join me for the interrogation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I'd love to.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meanwhile, I'm gonna need you guys to hit the street and see if you can scare up any of Finch's associates-- maybe anyone that he's taken scores with in the past or people that he owes. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What can I do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could watch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two weeks ago, I saved your life twice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for coming in, Mr. Cana.

utterance.speaker: FRED CANA
utterance.content: Call me Fred.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: And obviously, we're gonna do everything we can to help you recover your stolen property. Uh, what exactly was in the box?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Stamps.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Stamps?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Yeah, I collect 'em.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: It kinda surprises me it took you so long to reach out to us. The folks at the bank said they left you a half a dozen messages over the last couple of days.

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Well, I been busy, you know? I been working a lot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what is it that you do?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: I'm in, uh, private security.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This stamp collection, how much was it worth exactly?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Well, it's hard to put a price tag on an item like that because of, you know, the sentimental value.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who else knew that you were keeping it at the bank?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Just a select group of other stamp enthusiasts with whom I formed... relationships over the years.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: So how long you been a philatelist, Fred?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Hey, watch your mouth, pal. Fred Cana don't go that route.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Philately is the study of stamps, Mr. Cana, which you would know if you were, in fact, a collector. Come on, Fred. What's really in the box, huh? What'd they steal from you?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: I don't have to take this crap. I'm the victim here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, you guys rounding up the usual suspects?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and every hood this side of Harlem says Finch has been out of action for years. Where's Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she and Captain America are in there with Fred Cana.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fred Cana?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he's the guy who rented the safety...

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Officer Esposito!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, it's Detective Esposito now, Fred.

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fred here is a bagman for Victor Racine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who's Victor Racine?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: He's a syndicate man. Made the leap from organized crime to legitimate businessman while no one was looking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Racine is connected and untouchable.

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: You oughta know. Esposito and his old partner tried to touch him a few years back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How about I touch you instead?

utterance.speaker: CANA
utterance.content: Come on! Come on, tough guy!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let's go, man! Come on. Take a walk. All right? He's not worth it. Man...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell was that all about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He works for Victor Racine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victor Racine killed my partner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His name was Ike. Ike Thornton. We partnered up back when I was at the 54th. We worked the organized crime task force. Victor Racine was our target... until one day, Ike didn't come into work. It's like he just disappeared. To make matters worse, Internal Affairs came around here asking all these questions, talking like Ike had gone over, that he was working for Racine. It was an absolute load of crap. Couple of days later, some kids found Ike's car out by the docks... shot to hell, blood all over the seats.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All the hallmarks of a professional hit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, only we couldn't tie it back to Racine. His guys had dumped Ike's body so that we could never find it. The department shut down the whole operation after that. I transferred here. But I know one thing-- if Fred Cana has a safe deposit box, it's because he's holding something for Racine. And it ain't no stamps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wants blood.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well, I don't blame him. From the look of it, I'm guessing Racine had Finch killed for stealing from him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that explains why he was tortured-- so he'd give up his partner. You know, whatever they stole from that safe deposit box, Racine wants it back bad.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, but how did he get onto Finch in the first place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he recognized the great smell of Brut.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm sure that Racine is the kind of guy who has his sources.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: So you like our stamp collector for doing the deed on Racine's behalf?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure, except we called. He has witnesses willing to corroborate his whereabouts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course he does.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we have no proof otherwise.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Oh, speaking of which, they brought up the C.S.U. report on the crime scene. The car was wiped down. Other than Finch and his wife, we got no usable prints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we still don't have an I.D. On that metal symbol we found.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meanwhile, our stamp collector has an alibi, and we currently have no evidence. So what is our next step?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We talk to the real victim of our robbery-- Mr. Victor Racine.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Bold. I like your style.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, you think he's the kind of guy who's just gonna tell us what's in that box or maybe admit to killing the thief?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Watch and learn, Castle. Watch and learn.

utterance.speaker: RACINE
utterance.content: To what do I owe this pleasure, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A safe deposit box at Manhattan Mutual was broken into the other night, Mr. Racine. It was registered to an associate of yours-- Fred Cana.

utterance.speaker: RACINE
utterance.content: You don't say? What's this world coming to, huh? Mr. Cana claims that the box contained his stamp collection? Well, I've never known Mr. Cana to lie... To me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we believe that it held something a little bit more valuable- maybe something of yours.

utterance.speaker: RACINE
utterance.content: Oh, really? And why is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because one of the guys involved in the robbery was found murdered in a parking garage last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, actually, Mr. Finch was tortured before he was killed. Now why would someone do that if all he stole were stamps?

utterance.speaker: RACINE
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night?

utterance.speaker: RACINE
utterance.content: Home. And I have around-the-clock bodyguards... Who can attest to my whereabouts, but you don't think I killed Finch. You assume I had somebody do it for me, so you're here just to... count coup, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Sorry. What was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Plains Indians considered it an act of bravery to get close enough to one of their enemies to touch him with a coup stick. Is my hair...

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Looks good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RACINE
utterance.content: This item or items that were in the safety deposit box, if they're so valuable, why aren't you out chasing down Mr. Finch's associate in this endeavour? After all, you know what the old saying is-- no honour among thieves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, what'd I say? Waste of time.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well played, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "Well played"? All he did was deny it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you can learn a lot from a denial.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Like Racine hasn't found Finch's partner yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because Racine would never point us in that direction if he already knew who or where the partner was.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: He must want this guy pretty bad if he's willing to have the cops do his legwork for him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does it help Racine if we find Finch's partner first?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Racine's connected. He'd have no trouble having Finch's partner killed in jail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Okay. We'll be right there. Lanie's ready to fume the body.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: All right, you guys head back to the morgue. I'm gonna go see if Finch's financials have come in yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is so cool. Do you mind if I take pictures?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Knock yourself out. But if any of them end up on the Internet, I will hunt you down and hurt you. So... What's with the handsome robbery detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Demming? Oh, we're just working the case together. That's all.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. But then again, you have been working with Castle for a year and not a damn thing has happened, so... We had a pool going. I lost a lot of money on you two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yahtzee. The killer left a print when he closed our victim's eye. Let's run it.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We got a match on the print, but the guy it belongs to is dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But that's impossible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless he's a zombie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not a zombie. A cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Isaac... "Ike" Thornton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Esposito's old partner?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's alive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I went to his funeral, held his wife's hand. And now you're telling me he's alive and working for Racine, that he murdered Finch?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was the perfect disappearing act. He knew that everyone would think that Racine had killed him and dumped his body somewhere.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, I don't see how he could do it, to the badge, to me? I would've taken a bullet for him.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Esposito. This is Lieutenant Holliwell from Internal Affairs.

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: We've met.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You called I.A.?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I called 'em for your protection.

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Detective. I don't really enjoy being proved right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it you were the investigating officer when Ike Thornton disappeared?

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: I was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what put you onto him in the first place?

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: Racine was always one step ahead of us, like he always knew what we were thinking. It didn't take too much to figure out that he was being tipped off by a cop. Luckily, we had an informant at the time that confirmed it, but before we were able to arrest Thornton, he disappeared. Most likely found out that we were coming for him. When we found his car, we just assumed Racine killed him. Looks like he brought him into the family instead. Has Thornton contacted you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean, contacted me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. What exactly are you accusing my partner of?

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: I'm not accusing. I'm asking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Asking what... If I knew all along, if I was part of it? The answer's no.

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: It was such an elaborate hoax. It seems like it would take a little bit of planning, a little help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I just told you, I didn't know. What do you want me to do, take a poly?

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: Would you take a polygraph test?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Wait a minute-

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If it'll get you off my back.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Esposito, you don't have to do this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I want to.

utterance.speaker: HOLLIWELL
utterance.content: Good. My office. One hour.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That guy was out of line back there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'd be asking the same questions if I was in his shoes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know you can talk to me, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I put all that stuff behind me, bro. The only thing I have left from back then... Is this right here. Back in the day, when I was in the 54th, everybody used to carry one of these with 'em. It was like a sense of pride, you know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ike had one of those?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let me see it. The 54th. It must have broken off when he was struggling with Finch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know no one would blame you if you stepped off this case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Partner or not... He killed a man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This guy's pulled a ghost routine for years-- gave up his old life, his friends. A guy can't pull a disappearing act like that without help from somebody.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He had Racine's help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Racine or no Racine, he was married, right, has a kid? They must have known.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I saw Carol last month. She doesn't know anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sure about that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hell, I'm not sure about anything anymore.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where you going?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Take a poly, clear my name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go pick up the wife. Let's see what she knows.

utterance.speaker: CAROL THORNTON
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I don't believe you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His thumbprint's on our victim's body, Carol. He's alive. There's no other explanation.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Well, they never recovered Ike's body, so I don't know. Someone could've cut off his thumb and--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
